title: French highway signage
content:
I would like to know the font that is used in the French highway signage system, the general belief is it is a Frutiger, but can somebody confirm this? Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/D43.gif)

comments.content:
I’m not sure of the font, and my French is non-existant, but this would appear to be the official documentation.

[http://www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/IMG/pdf/INS-1p-oct02.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185912/http:/www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/IMG/pdf/INS-1p-oct02.pdf "http://www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/IMG/pdf/INS-1p-oct02.pdf")

from this site

[http://www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/infos-ref/route/signalisation/l-inst...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185912/http:/www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/infos-ref/route/signalisation/l-instruction-interministerielle-sur-la-signalisat.html "http://www.securiteroutiere.gouv.fr/infos-ref/route/signalisation/l-instruction-interministerielle-sur-la-signalisat.html")
It’s NOT Frutiger, that I do know. Not sure what tho.
if Sweden can afford to have their own typeface especially made for their signage, i’m sure France would too.. so my guess is that it’s not a widely available typeface.
For something similar you could look at HTF Gotham Condensed, Erbar, or Interstate Condensed (based on US highway signage)
